greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period 6: repeat [1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0].
comment: For periodic sequences having a period of 2*k and composed of k ones followed by k zeros we have a(n) = floor(((n+k) mod 2*k)/k).  Sequences of this form are A000035(n+1) (k=1), A133872(n) (k=2), this sequence (k=3), A131078(n) (k=4), and A112713(n-1) (k=5). [_Gary Detlefs_, May 17 2011]
link: Index entries for sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,-1,1).
formula: Partial sums of expansion of 1/(1+x^3), see A131531.
a(n) = 1/2 + cos(Pi*n/3)/3 + sin(Pi*n/3)/sqrt(3) + (-1)^n/6. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 08 2011
a(n) = floor(((n+2)^2)/3) mod 2. [_Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 29 2013]
a(n) = a(n-1) - a(n-3) + a(n-4) for n>3. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jul 05 2016
results.author: Mario Catalani (mario.catalani(AT)unito.it), Oct 22 2003
